## Introduction 

*_My Good and Bad Plot on Car Data_*

### Load Data
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(patchwork)
library(dplyr)
library(reshape2)
library(beyonce)
```

### Inspect Data 
```{r}
View(mtcars)
glimpse(mtcars)

```


### Make Bad Plot 
```{r cars, fig.align='center', fig.asp=1.5, fig.cap="car mpg", echo = FALSE, dev='png'}

mtcars %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = mpg, 
             y = hp,
             fill = cyl,
             na.rm=FALSE, 
             label = rownames(mtcars))) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 12),
        panel.grid = element_line(color = "pink"), 
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = "violet"), 
        legend.key = element_rect(color = "beige")) +
  geom_bar(width=0.5, stat="identity", color = "green") + 
  coord_polar("y", start=0) +
  geom_text_repel() + 
  ggtitle("cars mpg and hp")

```


## Good Plot
```{r mtcars, fig.align='center', fig.asp=1.5, fig.cap="Comparison of mph in various Cars from 1970s study", echo = FALSE, dev='png'}

```
Good Plot

```{r mtcars, fig.align='center', fig.asp=1.5, fig.cap="Comparison of mph in various Cars from 1970s Study", echo = FALSE, dev='png}
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = hp, 
                   y = mpg, 
                   label = rownames(mtcars))) + 
  labs(x = "Horsepower", 
       y = "Miles Per Gallon") + 
  theme_bw() + 
  geom_text_repel() + #repels to make text easy to read
  geom_count(color = 'violet') + 
  ggtitle("Comparison of Horsepower and MPG in Cars")
ggsave(here("Good_Plot_Bad_Plot", "output","goodplot.png"))

```
